newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks mixed, traders expect rise.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks mixed, traders expect rise.

text.p: Croatian stocks were mixed on Thursday and brokers predicted general rise of prices as market becomes more lively in the next weeks.
"I think all prices will keep rising mildly as the activities pick up in the following week," one trader told Reuters.
* Of seven active issues three rose, two were flat, one was down and one traded for the first time.
* Most actively traded food processor Podravka gained 15 kuna to 230 on volume of 3,056 shares.
* Fully listed Zagrebacka banka was up 20 kuna to 690 with 670 shares changing hands.
* Brewery Karlovacka Pivovara edged up two kuna to 180 selling 126 units.
* Both hoteliers which traded today were flat.
- Laguna Porec sold 30 shares at 800 kuna.
raded for the first time and sold 33 shares at 442.6 kuna.
* The only loser, drugs firms Pliva, was down 250 kuna at 11,100 kuna, but only 32 shares were sold.
* Public debt refinancing bonds were down at 14.5 percent above par on total turnover of under 8 million kuna. They were of August.
* Daily turnover down at 10.1 million kuna, volume also lower at 4,340 shares.
* Central Bank's exchange rate: 5.2556 = $ 1. -- Metka Jelenc, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075.
